detaileddescription.para: Stores the logical expression being processed.
Represents the input cache machines and their names.
Represents the output cache machine and their name.
Stores the parent kernel identifier if any.
Indicates whether the execution is complete.
Stores the id of the kernel type.
Stores a pointer to the current execution graph.
Shared context of the running query.
Indicates if the Logical plan only contains a LogicalTableScan (or BindableTableScan) and LogicalLimit.
Specifies the maximum number of rows to return.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::size_t kernel_id, std::string expr, std::shared_ptr< Context > context, kernel_type kernel_type_id)
memberdef.name: kernel

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor for the kernel
kernel_id
Current kernel identifier.
expr
Original logical expression that the kernel will execute.
context
Shared context associated to the running query.
kernel_type_id
Identifier representing the kernel type.

briefdescription.para: Sets its parent kernel.
Indicates if the kernel has a parent.

simplesect.para: true If the kernel has a parent, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Executes the batch processing. Loads the data from their input port, and after processing it, the results are stored in their output port.

simplesect.para: kstatus 'stop' to halt processing, or 'proceed' to continue processing.

briefdescription.para: Returns the kernel identifier.
Returns the kernel type identifier.
Sets the kernel type identifier.
Returns the input cache.
Returns the output cache associated to an identifier.

simplesect.para: cache_id The identifier of the output cache.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::unique_ptr< ral::frame::BlazingTable > table, std::string cache_id="", bool always_add=false)
memberdef.name: add_to_output_cache

briefdescription.para: Adds a BlazingTable into the output cache.

parameterdescription.para: The table that will be added to the output cache.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::unique_ptr< ral::cache::CacheData > cache_data, std::string cache_id="", bool always_add=false)
memberdef.name: add_to_output_cache

briefdescription.para: Adds a CacheData into the output cache.

parameterdescription.para: The cache_data that will be added to the output cache.

briefdescription.para: Adds a BlazingHostTable into the output cache.

parameterdescription.para: The host table that will be added to the output cache.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current context.
Returns the id message as a string.
Returns true if all the caches of an input are finished.
Returns sum of all the rows added to all caches of the input port.
Returns true if a specific input cache is finished.
Returns the number of rows added to a specific input cache.
Returns the estimated num_rows for the output, the default is that its the same as the input (i.e. project, sort, ...).

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< std::unique_ptr< ral::frame::BlazingTable > > inputs, std::shared_ptr< ral::cache::CacheMachine > output, cudaStream_t stream, const std::map< std::string, std::string > &args)
memberdef.name: process

briefdescription.para: Invokes the do_process function.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< std::unique_ptr< ral::frame::BlazingTable > >, std::shared_ptr< ral::cache::CacheMachine >, cudaStream_t, const std::map< std::string, std::string > &)
memberdef.name: do_process

briefdescription.para: Implemented by all derived classes and is the function which actually performs transformations on dataframes.

parameterdescription.para: the output cache to write the output to
any additional arguments the kernel may need to perform its execution that may not be available to the kernel at instantiation.

briefdescription.para: given the inputs, estimates the number of bytes that will be necessary for holding the output after performing a transformation. For many kernels this is not an estimate but rather a certainty. For operations whose outputs are of indeterminate size it provides an estimate.

parameterdescription.para: the data that would be transformed

simplesect.para: the number of bytes that we expect to be needed to hold the output after performing this kernels transformations on the given inputs.

briefdescription.para: given the inputs, estimates the number of bytes that will be necessary for performing the transformation. This can be thought of as the memory overhead of the actual transformations being performed. For many kernels this is not an estimate but rather a certainty. For operations that perform indeterminately sized allocations based on the contents of inputs it provides an estimate.

parameterdescription.para: the data that would be transformed

simplesect.para: the number of bytes that we expect to be needed to hold the output after performing this kernels transformations on the given inputs.

briefdescription.para: notify the kernel that a task it dispatched was completed successfully.
notify the kernel that a task it dispatched failed.
add a task to the list of tasks the kernel is waiting to complete.
check and see if all the tasks were completed.

This interface represents a computation unit in the execution graph. Each kernel has basically and input and output ports and the expression asocciated to the computation unit. Each class that implements this interface should define how the computation is executed. See do_process() method.
